Alba Ecstasy.about:
This album was composed between 2002-2003 and all the original tracks have been lost or worked in DAWs that are no longer available.
The "mastering" has been made after 64-128 kbps mp3 files so the quality is quite poor.
Still, you can enjoy the charm of that period of my creativity!

Alba Ecstasy.title: A Classic Move
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Music should be a personal statement of who the artist is.
In his music, the musician must put his feeling, his thoughts, his way of being.
He must be sincere and brave enough to show to the world his personality through the music he made.
Probably this is the most honest way to keep a relation strong. With itself, with the listeners and with the music.
This is the 100th release, but not the 100th album.
For a detailed discography and unreleased (yet) albums, please check:  www.albaecstasy.ro/discography/

The Infinite Blue journey ends here.
It was a storm of emotions, of thoughts and memories.
The album contains new tracks but also some old ones (2014->), published here in premiere.

What's coming next?
The anniversary album of 20 years of music.
Back in 1999 I released my first album: SPIRITUAL.
Stay tuned for it, plus something more!

Alba Ecstasy.title: Before the Big Bang
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Album nominated to Schallwelle Electronic Music Award 2015
-----------------
When such beautiful words comes from an expert in Electronic Music, Mr. Sylvain Lupari, I feel that I'm on the right path and as a sign that shows me that the music is flowing well in my blood.
Read here an amazing review of the "Before the Big Bang" album:
synthsequences.blogspot.ro/2015/11/alba-ecstasy-before-big-bang-2015.html
-----------------
DRAGOS MANEA about "Before the Big Bang:
The music presented on this album surprises the listener with some extravagant mixes of musical styles: electronic, rhythmic/ entraining electronica, deep space and sometimes even overtones, that makes you travel far away in exotic places on Earth, like in the sacred snowy mountains and lakes from Tibet. Maybe the idea behind it is to link what was before the Big-Bang with the general idea of ‚Äúsacred‚Äù, the Oneness from which all things emerged.
In the Eastern mystical traditions, the overtones are seen as being sacred. They represent the underlying vibratory structure of the Universe and are more or less regarded in a similar way the modern science of cymatics sees the sound. Also, they represent a principle of Creation.
I've tried to express in words my impressions for each track:
‚ÄúThe pursuit ‚Äì Intro‚Äù - Starts like an invitation to a journey, a mysterious one, mostly an inner one, meant to discover the secrets of the Universe, but using your own conscience as a vehicle.
‚ÄúRemonstrance‚Äù - An elaborated combination of rhythmic sequences, entraining sounds, overtones and flutes. After all the rhythms fade away, a stillness installs in the mind and the soul of the listener, as if he is prepared (purified) for the next tune (or revelation).
‚ÄúBefore the Big Bang‚Äù - It starts with a subtle noise that captures the essence of or suggests the creational process, how the things emerged from non-manifested in the manifested world. Here, the sounds are twisted and pulled in all possible ways, suggesting how the things came into shape by complex cycles of transformations.
‚ÄúVoice of consciousness‚Äù (my favorite one) - It starts with a calming and soothing atmosphere. It's more subtle than the preceding ones. It tends to elevate the consciousness of the listener. As if, after the Creation took place, the Spirit walks upon the face of the waters and contemplates what has been done... And suddenly a big surprise occurs: a rhythmic explosion of sounds in Berlin-School and trace style but combined with a complex mix of Tuvan throat singing, mostly overtones. It's like the Universal Life Force expresses itself in myriads of ways throughout the whole Universe.
‚ÄúRetrospective ‚Äì Outro‚Äù - As even the name implies it's a synthesis and an overview of the things depicted in the whole album, spiced with a bit of melancholy in some places. I had that impression without noticing the title of the tune.
I recommend this album for those meditative EM fans that want to take a ride in the deepest corners of the Universe, both in space and time!
DM on FB:  www.facebook.com/manea.dragos
-------
NORD about this album:
With the album "Before the Big Bang" Alba Ecstasy leads the listener on an acoustic journey through space and time to the origins of the Universe where it becomes obvious that there were first off different resonances, frequencies and sounds. These sounds are reproduced with care by the author, with his arsenal of synthesizers and his skill as a sound designer. The result is an well done album, neat - in terms of frequencies and sounds, creating to the listener an unique experience in the sound world of the Universe, transposed through the mind and soul of Alba Ecstasy.
Nord on FB:  www.facebook.com/nordmusic.ro

released September 1, 2015
Artwork by Haris Liviu:  thecreativehero.tumblr.com

Alba Ecstasy.title: üåì D√§mmerlicht
Alba Ecstasy.about:
This is a project I wanted to start in 2012 under this alias but only now I decided to make it public, with the original name project, to keep the flavor of the original idea. I hope you‚Äôll enjoy it!
Alba Ecstasy
Alba Ecstasy.credits:
released March 26, 2016
‚ÄúD√§mmerlicht offers 3 suites which complement each other well with a beautiful transition between the moods and the rhythms which aims to be more accentuated as we move forward to parts 2 and 3‚Äù
1 D√§mmerlicht Part I 11:49
2 D√§mmerlicht Part II 12:46
3 D√§mmerlicht Part III 14:47
Alba Ecstasy Music (DDL 39:22) ***¬Ω
(Minimalist Roumanian School with a zest of light Electronica)
The music! The colors of sounds and the forms of tones! In the hands of a sculptor-musician these sounds and these tones become notes which ring and flutter, describing bows and sound spirographs which bewitch, otherwise create a certain dependence.
Mihail Adrian Simion, or if you prefer better Alba Ecstasy, is a whole phenomenon. I approach his albums with a bit of suspicion, asking me every time if that is going to be good. Is it possible to create some good music while composing it at a level of industrial way? I don't count his albums anymore that he has sent me recently in a package of 5. ‚ÄúD√§mmerlicht‚Äù is an album designed for another project, Hieronymus, whom Alba Ecstasy has tempted to set up at the beginning of 2012. This short album proposes 3 suites to ‚ÄúD√§mmerlicht‚Äù and plunges the listener into the minimalist jewels of Indra's works, the Klaus Schulze of Roumania, but into an approach which favors as much the musing than the soft and hypnotic EDM.
Ringings of bells and two lines of sequences which intertwine their pace and skip briskly in tones of bass and of crystal open the delicately jerky rhythm of "D√§mmerlicht Part I". The movement is hypnotic and offers nuances in the routes of the sequences which sometimes draw stroboscopic shapes and sometimes forge mislaid harmonies of which the airs crystallize their charms with the ringings of the bells. The mixture of the echos of both tones whistles for an azure wind while the shadows of sequences force this herd of keys to agglutinate in a compact mass from where gets out a bass line and so gives more heat to the very moired approach of "D√§mmerlicht Part I". The movement accelerates substantially with the arrived of the percussions of which the beatings shake the shadows of the jumping keys and the light bangings of metal, giving an unsuspected sound wealth to a minimalist approach which gives itself the time to deploy its factory of charms. I really enjoyed this "D√§mmerlicht Part I". That reminds to me the best of Indra! "D√§mmerlicht Part II" begins with a storm of winds and growls which seem to shake the chains of time. Some nice orchestrations nest on this meshing of sibylline elements while the sequences, always so crystal clear, get organized as in "D√§mmerlicht Part I" to ring in a melodious approach. A line of heavy, resonant and lively bass as well as some sober percussions structure a kind of astral funk which serves as support for a synth rather jazzy. It's quite different but it listens to rather well. "D√§mmerlicht Part III" is also rather different with an approach more in the kind of morphic mid-tempo. Sequences always skip by drawing arches of melodies while the pulsations and the percussions forge a steady rhythm but rather out of sync in front of the harmonious skipping of sequences. The 2nd part is livelier.
We would never know what was the future of Hieronymus! Of what I understand, Alba Ecstasy tried to breathe movements of dance into an EM always very hypnotic. At this level ‚ÄúD√§mmerlicht‚Äù offers 3 suites which complement each other well with a beautiful transition between the moods and the rhythms which aims to be more accentuated as we go to parts 2 and 3. But for me, "D√§mmerlicht Part I" is a wonderful piece of music which makes shade to the growth and the direction of the beats of its following parts.
Sylvain Lupari (May 10th, 2016)
gutsofdarkness.com  &  synthsequences.blogspot.ca

Alba Ecstasy.title: Dawns
Alba Ecstasy.about:
15:56:55
Created in 2015, mostly with modular synthesizers, Dawns is a dark cinematic ambient album, focused in creating a misterious and ambiguous picture.
A post apocalitic world, drowned in toxic residues, the legacy of the greedy humans... There‚Äôs almost nothing left on Earth, other than the last survivors, trying to figure out what to do next.

Alba Ecstasy.title: I AM
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Tracks 1 to 5 are composed between 2010-2011.
Tracks 6 & 7 are composed in 2015.
The tracks composed between 2010-2011 are very important to me.
It was a very busy period for me at that time, when I had two jobs, and the tracks are composed early in the morning,
usually from 6.00-8.00 AM, between the night shift of one job and the morning shift of the other job. So, I was working
20 hours by day and from the remaining time I had, two hours were reserved for sleep and the most two important
hours were for making music - the best hours of the day! My silent hours, my full of joy and living hours.
I was so present in those two hours of music, that every time I listen them I even feel the smell of those mornings.
This is how the "I AM" project was born.
Most of the tracks have been recorded in one shot and mixed in one track along with the video.
There wasn't too much time then, to properly record the audio and video separate and mix them after,
so, a compromise solution was to record both in one mov file in a software.
Cracks, pops may be present because of the recording conditions.
But still, one of the closest albums to my heart!
The download contains the original audio-video recording of the I AM AIRY.
Also, the other videos are the original ones from 2010-2011, their audio not being mastered.
Enjoy it!
Alba Ecstasy
Bucharest 12 September 2015

Alba Ecstasy.title: Mahabhuta
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Mahabhuta - a Dragos Manea review
In every ancient philosophical system, in any metaphysical or esoteric system the elements were regarded as very important. Why? Because understanding their interplay could lead to the understanding of all the physical phenomena that manifest in our physical reality. Furthermore, through a very long and complex study and a discipline of oneself, the initiated can become a master of the elements (Each of the first five chakras, from bottom-up, controls one of the 5 elements) and thus he can become a master of his own life (The human being is made up of these elements, too).
The subject of the metaphysical elements is a reccuring theme in any form of art. The Romanian synthesist, Alba Ecstasy, could not miss it, either. Through his music he invites us to explore it and he offers us a way to tune our conscience to the level of understanding this delicate matter. For his album, ‚ÄúMahabhuta‚Äù, he has chosen the Hindu system approach, that takes into account five elements: Ether, Air, Fire, Water and Earth. The album places the Ether on the first place, the Ether being considered a governor element. It is also the element closest to the conscience.
Most of the tunes are constructed around the pattern: drones from which rhythmic sequences emerge from time to time.
The album encompasses 6 tracks:
1. Abyss
A depiction of the source from which all the elements emerged.
It starts with sounds coming out from the deep. Moments later, out of the depths, something emerges/appears. A sequence performed in the background animates the landscape.
2. Erased moments
The tune gravitates between solemn resonant sounds repeated at ostinato and a sequence that only stimulates the ears of the listener in order to prepare him for the next tune. I would have expected that the author would develop the solemn theme, but the listener's mind continues to develop it by itself, anyway...
3. Mahabhuta part 1
The beginning of the track is in some way similar to the concrete music, but the sounds are synthesized. The sounds are twisted and metamorphosized by the author and they subtly become sounds of steps to lead us somewhere (In the depths of our consciousness?)
The beginning takes us in Alpha state and, from time to time, the track jumps into Theta state. After almost 20 minutes the listener is in a state close to the sleep (theta). The sound of rain emphasizes this state and these sampled sounds become like a caress in this very relaxed state. On the ocean something distinguishable appears. A sweet short improvisation... and then... a sublime sequence in Berlin-School style! For me it seems that it represents the rhythm of life that emerges over the matter. The sequence's sounds (coming from Roland Aira) with analogue-like flavour are reminiscent of late '80 - early '90 electronic music tunes and somehow nostalgic. The tune ends symmetrically with sampled sounds in the first plane. It seems that the author has mastered the art of using sounds, be them synthesized or sampled, to help the listener to achieve deeper states of consciousness.
4. The Tree
The tune starts with a synthesized sound that imitates the wind. The image of a tree in the wind in the autumn appears before my eyes.
5. Mahabhuta part 2
The track is almost a low-frequency drone (theta). You'll feel like in a Sci-Fi movie!
6. The Whisperer
After the intro an entraining BS sequence appears. It may have the role of bringing the listener from the deep states previously created to the present moment of space and time. Also, it looks like this special rhythm clears somehow the mind.
I recommend this album to those who are looking for for subtle forms of arts!
With this album, Alba Ecstasy explore the experimental sound, touching a little bit the universe of drone music.
Please enjoy and rate this album!
More to come!

Space.

The reason of all my wonderings.

Alba Ecstasy.about:
Today, 14 December, is exactly one month since I started (14 November) this series of live recordings that I published on Youtube under the title "Quiet Saturdays".
This album is containg the mastered tracks from the Youtube live performances "Quiet Saturdays - Episodes".
Volume 1 contains Episodes 1 to 5 plus one Bonus track, named "Bonus Episode" - a track without a video recording.
You can watch the videos here:  www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJb3KvzTw9q8otzqiqqLHwzYwxSLeJdrC
Thanks for watching and don't forget to subscribe to my Youtube channel to see new series!

Alba Ecstasy.title: Quiet Saturdays Vol. 4
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Over 1h 30min of live Berlin School electronic music!
Episode 24 - special, was the initial Episode 24 recorded, only using the Novation Circuit, in one recording session. But because the light of the picture was too low and I used too much reverb from Circuit on almost all its channels (was the first use of the Novation Circuit in this way), I quit the ideea of publishing the video at that time and kept it only as a bonus track. The video will be made publicly at some point.
Thank you!
ae

Alba Ecstasy.title: Quiet Saturdays Vol. 7
Alba Ecstasy.about:
14 tracks, 2h 12min 45sec
Last volume from the Quiet Saturdays series.
Episode 41 is in double take: for the first session I lost the video.
Usually I leave the episode like that, but this time, I really wanted to offer you a video. So I recorded one more time the idea. You'll hear the difference between two improvisations with same setup sounds.
Also, this is the reason why I lost the count and for the last episode I had to record both Episodes 51 and 52.
Thank you for being a part of this journey!
More to come on Saturday!
Youtube Episodes (all): bit.ly/2aWDVjr

Alba Ecstasy.title: Quiet Saturdays Vol. 8
Alba Ecstasy.about:
I started the Quiet Saturdays series in December 2015 and 11 months later, in November 2016, I thought that Volume 7 would be the last one.
But, last year, in July 2023, I woke up on that Saturday 22nd and my inner voice whispered to me: "what a Quiet Saturday is today! Let's make some music and bring back to life those moments!"
Because those 11 months and 7 Volumes of Quiet Saturdays remained imprinted in me as one of the most... QUIET - that's the word! - and passionate moments of my artistic life!
So, here I am: half year later, with a new volume, this time with a more minimalist line but more meditative and focused on deep emotions.
Thanks again for your support!
Alba Ecstasy

Alba Ecstasy.title: Quiet Saturdays Vol. X
Alba Ecstasy.about:
9 years ago, on December 14th, 2015, the first album of the Quiet Saturdays series was released.
Today, the 10th album and the last one - "X" - is ending this amazing journey I had.
On that first Saturday - November 14th 2015 - when I sat down in my home studio in front of my synthesisers and sequencers, I didn't even know what I was going to accomplish: beside the perseveration and discipline, and all the skills and techniques I have achieved, the most important thing is that I met a lot of great people who supported this project: YOU!
And for that, I can only say a heartfelt THANK YOU!
I hope you too had some great Saturdays or at least a Quiet ones!
And, in this ending is found a new beginning so I invite you in a new journey I started for the last weeks: Berlin School Reveries!
‚ù§Ô∏è, ae

Alba Ecstasy.title: Requiem
Alba Ecstasy.about:
The tracks from this album are conceived to lay a proper foundation for the evolution and expansion of the human consciousness.
In order to achieve this it is required that the human being frees himself/herself from fears, become more self-confident, heals himself from any disease and awakens his intuition and his spiritual judgment.
The purpose of this album is to help fulfilling the above-mentioned goals, in a such way that after that the new Being, reborned through the Energy of Love and Light, will begin to perceive very clearly the Divine Presence.
The results are depending on each individual. This music is just a support to induce or sustain the meditation.
* Listening to this album can trigger the entering into the Theta state.
** This album contains a sacred code of the frequencies that can help overcoming some obstacle met on the road of the spiritual growth.
*** It is recommended to listen to the music using headphones and adequate volume.
Artwork contained when downloading.
Prin piesele prezente pe acest album (Requiem - Alba Ecstasy, 2013) se intentioneaza crearea unui fundament solid, potrivit evolutiei si expansionarii constiintei umane.
Pentru aceasta este necesar ca fiinta umana sa se elibereze de starile de teama, sa dobandeasca mai multa incredere in fortele proprii, sa se vindece de eventuale boli, sa isi trezeasca intuitia si discernamantul.
Intentia acestui album (Requiem - Alba Ecstasy, 2013) este de a ajuta la indeplinirea obiectivelor de mai sus, pentru ca apoi, noua fiinta, renascuta, prin energia Iubirii si a Luminii, sa inceapa sa perceapa cu claritate Prezenta Divina.
Rezultatele depind de fiecare individ in parte. Acesta este doar un suport muzical care poate permite inducerea sau mentinerea unei meditatii.
* In timpul audierii acestui album (Requiem - Alba Ecstasy, 2013), intrarea in starea Theta este posibila.
** Acest album contine un cod sacru al frecventelor care poate ajuta la depasirea anumitor obstacole in evolutia spirituala.
*** Este recomandata audierea cu ajutorul castilor la un volum adecvat.
Alba Ecstasy

Alba Ecstasy.title: Seven Earths
Alba Ecstasy.about:
REMASTERED February 2025
After NASA's announcement from yesterday (February 22nd), that Seven new Planets like Earth have been discovered, I decided to make this album.
One track of 35:49 minutes, consisting of seven parts.
Composed today (February 23rd), most of the were tracks taken in one shot, live, inspired by the vastness of this Universe.
Seven new Earths! How it would be?!
I'm looking with excitement, but also with fear: I know that humans are capable of beautiful gestures but also their tendency to expand, to overtake new teritories, is making me to remain in expectative...
Hoping for better worlds and times,
Trully Yours, Alba Ecstasy

Alba Ecstasy.title: Spiritual (1999)
Alba Ecstasy.about:
1999 was a turning point in my life, but also one the most challenging years.
Recently returned from France (Moissy Cramayel) where with my pop-rock band ARCA recorded a CD  (www.albaecstasy.ro/biography/),  I realized that Electronic Music is closer to my heart than any other musical genre.
From that moment, sleepless nights followed and one month later this album was ready.
Mostly made with samples on a Pentium MMX computer (233MHz as far as I remember!) and some desktop computer speakers - so nothing professional at all, spending my nights arranging this music, commuting, in the morning, for work and university.
Those were intense days, filled with that burning desire of making music and touching my dreams!
Then, 3 months later, after loosing my grandmother - one of the most important person in my life - hard moments followed.
I dedicated myself to hard work since all my incomes being spent almost entirely on rent... Days of starvation (literally), anxiety and depression.
Music and writing poetry were the only ways to get out of that mess...
Since then, 20 years has passed...
With ups and downs, with or without having the time or the possibility to make music, but always dedicated and focused to the idea that one day I'll be an Electronic Musician.
Here I am now.
Living my dream.
This is a my SPIRITUAL album. My first step in music.
A gift for you.
Thank you!
Love,
Alba Ecstasy
PS: the image from lower right corner (the one with the album title), is the original album cover from 1999.

Alba Ecstasy.title: Synth Collection, Vol. 1
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Synth Collection, Vol. 1 (2021) represents a collection of tracks worked with minimal studio setup, all of them being composed using only one hardware synthesizer, ("Space Cadet" being the exception), the resulted worked being representative for that synth, as character, texture, sound, integration in mix, etc., from my perspective.
Time Traveller (originally named: "MKBS91914", 2014), it's an old "Korg microKorg - one synth challenge" track, remastered for this album.
A Lost Vision is made with Behringer DeepMind 6, including the drums.
Startdust: Sequential Take 5, drums from Native Instruments - Drumlab
Space Cadet: Sequential Take 5, Prophet REV 2, DSI Toraiz AS-1 and Novation Peak
Sequential Feelings: Sequential Take 5
In Solitude: Analog Keys.
Additional software effects: Arturia MiniFilter, Arturia M12, Valhalla Space Modulator, Waves H-Delay, Valhalla SuperMassive, Eventide Blackhole.

Alba Ecstasy.title: Synth Therapy
Alba Ecstasy.about:
This music haunted my mind for the last months: twelve short minimal tracks, something else than my usual Berlin School: a dark minimal synthwave-ish ambient, but still having my signature (once sequencing - always sequencing!).
I started this album in 2018 and until today I changed my mind several times about publishing this music or not.
Why this music? Why did I changed my mind so many times? This music is very personal, having here a personal way to fight against anxiety.
That's why, this music could sound a little dark, unusual from my floating sequences, but this creating in this style, helped me a lot to reduce that interior fight! Now, you know.
And if in these modern days people (mostly men) are not willing to talk about this, I found out that, showing to the others your way to get out of a situation, might help others to find their solution.
Sincerely,
Alba Ecstasy
Gear used for this album:
Hardware synths: ARP Odyssey, Roland JUNO-106, Roland JP-8000, DeepMind 6, Toraiz AS-1, Korg Minilogue, Digitone, Digitakt, Analog Keys, Roland SH-01A/JU-06/JP-08/JX-03/SE-02, Virus Ti2, Blofeld, Roland JV-1080, Roland System-1, Roland JD-Xi, MoPho keyboard, Korg microKorg, Nord Lead 3.
Effects: Roland Demora, Roland Torcido, Neunaber Slate, Boss RV-6, Boss DD-7, Boss-RV-3, Behringer RV600/FL600, Waves H-Delay, Waves H-Reverb, Soundstoys Little Plate, Soundtoys Echoboy
Sequencers: Roland MSQ-100, MC-50 mkII, internal synths sequencers.

Alba Ecstasy.title: Ten Stories, Vol. 1
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Ten Stories is more like a compilation of tracks I made during 2015-2016, tracks that are the results of some particular (life & spiritual) experiences. So, being quite different than my usual Berlin School style, I reunited them as a collection of ten stories.
I hope you'll enjoy it!
AE
Gear used:
Eurorack modular mix: Quadnic, Z3000 mkII, Braids, Ripples, Doepfer A-106-5 12db SEM VCF, Warps, Tides, Clouds...
Synthesizers: System-1, Promars, SH-101, System-100, Virus Ti2, Volca FM, Blofeld, Virus Ti2, microKorg, Korg Radias, OP-1
Drum machines: Circuit, Radias, OP-1
Sequencers: OP-1, Circuit, Beatstep Pro

It is a Journey that Never Ends. It is Our Journey to our Cosmic Roots.
Enjoy it!

Alba Ecstasy.title: The Best of Live Studio, Vol. 1
Alba Ecstasy.about:
This is the first volume of a compilation of all live studio performances* of Alba Ecstasy, published or not on the internet (Youtube, Vimeo, Soundcloud, Mixcloud etc).
Over 80 minutes of music!
The tracks have been (re)mastered, but some of them were "polished" having very poor quality sources, most of the "old" live studio recordings being recorded directly in some audio video capture software not so professional at that time.
But still, Alba Ecstasy considers that also these tracks being his "kids" that deserve to be well known!
This compilation include two new live tracks: Immuable & Tranquillity (both March 2015) but their video material has been damaged (pay attention to your SD video cards, AE!).
Enjoy!
*live studio performances - in this case it means that all tracks have been composed, played & recorded in one shot, no overdubbing and no rehearsals. Exception make the first track, MKBS91914 - being made with one synthesizer, Korg microKorg, overdubbed in Logic Pro.

trackinfo.title: Void (2015) (free download)
trackinfo.about:
In meditation, touching the Void - the absence of thoughts - can be sometimes, a very difficult process.
An experience of ‚Äòthe void‚Äô will only happen if we meditate as often as possible ‚Äì in silent retreat, with eyes closed.
But more often (beginner's luck!), the first experiences of this ‚Äòvoid‚Äô are very quick ‚Äì and they are very intense and beautiful. But as extraordinary as they are, in this first stage, they are a quite frightening to the mind and then, mind‚Äôs first reaction is to go ‚ÄòWOW!‚Äô, then immediately scramble to re-assert its usual activities.
It takes quite a few ‚Äòvoid‚Äô experiences to get used to it enough to let go and fall into it.
So one should meditate without looking for them ‚Äì and the more of these ‚ÄòWOW!‚Äô experiences we have, the more we become used to letting go of the conceptual reality we had always clung to, and accept this new ultimate reality.
And that‚Äôs the beginning of the process of enlightenment.
Enjoy!
Alba Ecstasy
trackinfo.credits: from The Best of Live Studio, Vol. 2, track released February 17, 2015

Alba Ecstasy.title: The Long Way to Mars
Alba Ecstasy.about:
"The idea of this album started back in January 2020, when Gustavo, a simulation training officer, invited me
to hold a synthesis workshop at the European Space Agency's ESOC mission control centre in Darmstadt, Germany.
I would also learn more about ESA's missions, and especially about the upcoming ExoMars Rover,
so that I could write and perform live a music album for its launch, then-planned for July 2020.
Shortly after, the 2020 pandemic begun and this project - and the launch of the Rover - was called off.
Due to Earth-Mars orbital mechanics, the next possible launch slot happens in 2022.
Despite this delay, Mars - thought to be one of the best candidates for life - serves as
the inspiration for this series of albums: The Long Way to Mars.
... "
//
You can find more details in the booklet that comes with the download.
AE
Alba Ecstasy.credits:
released October 2, 2020
Alba Ecstasy playing on:
Hardware synthesizers: Novation Peak, Access Virus Ti2, Prophet REV 2, Roland V-Synth GT 2.0, Arturia MatrixBrute, Korg Radias, Deepmind 6, Roland JU-06A
Hardware drums: Korg Radias
Software drums: Evolve Mutations 2
Software effects: Valhalla Supermassive, Waves H-Delay, Waves H-Reverb, Eventide Blackhole
Recording, mixing and mastering: Alba Ecstasy

Alba Ecstasy.title: The Untitled Album
Alba Ecstasy.about:
FREDERICH SHULLER - The Untitled Album - A Berlin School Journey
This first album is dedicated to my grandfather, Frederich Shuller.
Creating the Frederich Shuller project, was a very special experience for me.
Starting as a tribute to my grandfather, a powerful role model to me, soon I discovered that whenever I was in front of the synthesizers and wanted to compose a new track under this identity, I felt like I was another person with a different mind set.
The perspective about music was kind of strange to me, even I was using all the knowledge I was accumulating until that time as my own.
Even talking about this identity dissociation is like talking about a different person, another musician!
For the first in my life, time I truly understood how iconic actors are creating such credible and powerful movie characters!
In my case, most likely, the profound repespect I have to my grandfather (‚ÄúShully‚Äù, as my grandmother used to call him!), made me moulding into his way of being, and that‚Äôs how I succeeded to achieve new sonic perspectives.
Who was Frederich Shuller? With Saxon origins, he married my widowed grandmother and took care of her family and her children and grandchildren, with such unconditioned love and sacrifice that I almost have never seen in another man.
He was a hard working man, strong, but kind. I never saw him angry, and no matter how hard the night shift was, he was in line for his adopted family.
For me, the real Frederich Shuller is a hero.
I miss you, ‚Äútataie‚Äù!
ae

Alba Ecstasy.title: Unpredictable Intersections Over the Time and Now (2015)
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Album nominated to Schallwelle Electronic Music Award 2015
First album of Alba Ecstasy on 2015.
All the moments of our lives are closely linked and interconnected and only small hiatuses are separating them - hiatuses that are "throwing" us on different levels of consciousness.
If there are times when we think we live unnecessary or unpleasant moments, those moments are actually only preparatory lessons for what will follow in our lives. Nothing is in vain.
I encourage you to listen carefully, quietly, looking inwards.
AE

Alba Ecstasy.title: Voices from the Past (2016)
Alba Ecstasy.about:
Starting this new year 2016, with a more introspective abum: Voices from the Past.
Composed enterely with my modular synth, this drone music album is based on live ambient recodings (music, room sounds, poetry reciting, urban sounds) processed with MI Clouds, and passed by analog filters.
This is the first album when the modular synthesizer is entirely used, only on the Part 2 I used for the pad the Virus Ti2. No external effects were added and the post processing is minimum, wanted to keep enterely the atmosphere produced by working with a modular synth (noise, cracks/pops)
All tracks are recorded in one shot, with no rehearseal and have only one track (excepting the track 2 - as I mentioned above).
Alba Ecstasy
